channel.title: downtownTV.com presents FLOW
channel.description: Flow is a television show co-hosted by Rephstar, Pattydukes and Crosby who are the 3 founding members of the Flow collective. the Flow collective is a group of urban artists from various disciplines who create and entertain together, offering their very best preexisting and free-flow work.
channel.itunes:author: downtownTV.com
channel.itunes:subtitle: FLOW
channel.itunes:summary: Flow is a television show co-hosted by Rephstar, Pattydukes and Crosby who are the 3 founding members of the Flow collective. the Flow collective is a group of urban artists from various disciplines who create and entertain together, offering their very best preexisting and free-flow work. the Flow collective consists of singers, spinners, mcâ€™s and tappers, humorists and dancers of all sorts, rhythm and blues and pop artists, percussionists, poets, and denizens of the downtown nightlife scene. these shows took place at Bruckner Bar and Grill in the Bronx and feature Flow and their guests performing by themselves and joining forces in the free-flowing finale. the show's theme song Comin' At U (in All Forms of Media) is written by Crosby, Pattydukes and Rephstar.

item.title: episode 13: the flow finale
item.dc:creator: downtowntv
item.description: Flow finishes its first season on downtownTV.com with one of their fabled all-star ensemble Flow finales featuring Rephstar, Pattydukes, Crosby, Valerie Geffner, Becca Schack, Muffy, Fun Yung Moon, and Kamp Sushii. Look for Flow's return as guests on downtownTV.com's upcoming show Downtown Follies.

item.title: episode 12: becca and muffy
item.dc:creator: downtowntv
item.description: Becca Schack and Muffy return again to Flow. This time Becca performs her original composition 'Hot Rendez-vous' and Muffy delivers a most charming a cappella version of 'Cupcake'.

item.title: episode 11: muffy and becca
item.dc:creator: downtowntv
item.description: Muffy is an enigmatic chameleon whose composing and performing talents exist. Here she performs ‘Stop Looking At Me’ with Becca Schack who you shall meet on her own terms later. Then Muffy performs her classic Cupcake number. Stay tuned for the further adventures of Muffy and Becca.

item.title: episode 10: alexander cowings
item.dc:creator: downtowntv
item.description: Alexander Cowings is both classic and contemporary in that he is a first-rate singer, a classy performer and a tasty tapper all in one, as you will see in his performance of his own song ‘Dance’.

item.title: episode 9: aurora rose
item.dc:creator: downtowntv
item.description: Aurora Rose is a gifted young singer whose two numbers here consist of her own brand new song 'LoveBlues' and the classic 'Strange Fruit'. She then joins the Flow ensemble (Rephstar, Pattydukes, Crosby and Kamp Sushii) for a bilingual flow finale.

item.title: episode 8: valerie geffner
item.dc:creator: downtowntv
item.description: Multiple talents of Valerie Geffner - singer, actress, dancer, composer - come together beautifully in this performance of her song 'That Person'.

item.title: episode 7: kamp sushii
item.dc:creator: downtowntv
item.description: Kamp Sushii perform one of their own songs and then join the Flow ensemble (Rephstar, Pattydukes, Crosby and Aurora Rose) for a bilingual flow finale.

item.title: episode 6: flow (rephstar, pattydukes and crosby)
item.dc:creator: downtowntv
item.description: The Flow co-hosts (Rephstar, Pattydukes and Crosby) come together in this new edition of Flow offering some of their finest emceeing and flowing.

item.title: episode 5: emily king, kim kalesti
item.dc:creator: downtowntv
item.description: Emily King's debut album is coming out soon on J Records and will introduce her very special talents as a singer-songwriter to the world. Here's an intimate performance of 'Starting Brand New' from Emily followed by Kim Kalesti, a legendary jazz singer and Emily's mother, singing 'Hello Daydream'.

item.title: episode 4: fun yung moon
item.dc:creator: downtowntv
item.description: Fun Yung Moon is every surrealist's dream of a stately, spiritual and sensual rapper. For those who have seen and heard it all, it is now time to experience Fun Yung Moon.

item.title: episode 3: bunny sigler
item.dc:creator: downtowntv
item.description: Bunny Sigler, an R&B legend, operatic singer, entertainer of a world class order, and songwriter/producer for artists from Patti Labelle to The O'Jays and from Lou Rawls to Billy Paul, makes a rare appearance in the Bronx and puts on a spectacular impromptu performance first mixing up a bit with Flow, then singing one of his great Patti Labelle hits 'Somebody Loves You Baby' and climaxing with a bit of Othello he last performed in Venice (and we don't mean California).

item.title: episode 2: final flow of 2006
item.dc:creator: downtowntv
item.description: The final flow of 2006 appreciates our Flow regulars, surprise visitors and the magic of R&B legend and multiple genius Bunny Sigler flowing freely his feelings for the open coffin of James Brown he couldn't see that day and the beauty of Steve Paul and his flow friends (Rephstar, Pattydukes, Crosby, Muffy, Alexander Cowings, Kim Kalesti, Emily King, and Becca Schack) who he could join in this, the final flow of the year 2006. Watch Flow forward in the year 2007.

item.title: episode 1: Comin' At U (in All Forms of Media)
item.dc:creator: downtowntv
item.description: the Flow co-hosts (Rephstar, Pattydukes and Crosby) perform the show's theme song Comin' At U (in All Forms of Media).
